title: Little Bighorn Battlefield National Monument: Places To Go
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Places To Go             Places To Go             Custer National Cemetery    On July 1, 1940, the management of the cemetery was transferred from the War Department to the Department of the Interior.            Indian Memorial    The Indian Memorial was built to honor all of the tribes defending their way of life at the Battle.        7th Calvary Memorial   By 1881, a memorial was erected in honor of the Seventh U.S. Cavalrymen who perished on the battlefield.        Explore the Battlefield    From the Visitor Center drive the tour road to retrace the steps of the Battle through multiple audio tour stops and exhibits.               Little Bighorn Battlefield Museum    Check out the Little Bighorn Battlefield Museum.         Deep Ravine Trail   Stretch your legs and learn more about the Battle of the Little Bighorn along our Deep Ravine Trail.        Reno-Benteen Memorial    Start or end your driving tour at the Reno-Benteen Memorial. Take a walk around the Reno-Benteen defensive site, and learn about the battle.
